column4: hey--trying to install kubuntu. using vmware to mount the iso, checked integrity--is fine. but when i try to boot it, it won't display on my 1440x900 monitor (geforce 8800gts 512

hey--trying to install kubuntu. using vmware to mount the iso, checked integrity--is fine. but when i try to boot it, it won't display on my 1440x900 monitor (geforce 8800gts 512MB) the boot screen shows up as 1280x1024 but even using F4 to set it to that (x32) it doesn't work. i'm clueless.
Once kubuntu is installed you can then install VMWare tools which will allow you to explicitly set the resolution of your monitor.

i'm not installing on vmware, i only used it to see if the integrity of the CD was ok. i'm trying to dual boot on my windows system which has the 'bios raid' (i guess that's another form of sw raid?) with nvraid--raid0, can i view my windows files from ubuntu & can i install ok? the main problem is the gfx at the moment
